prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Triangular Base Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a triangular base. The height of the prism is twice the width of the base. The prism is centered in the image. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0309, 0.0] 2. Draw the 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system with the following components: - Face 1 contains Loop 1: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.7191, 0.0309] - Line 3: [0.7191, 0.0309] to [0.0309, 0.0309] - Line 4: [0.0309, 0.0309] to [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch\\_scale scaling parameter: 0.75 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch: - euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - translation vector: [0.0, 0.0309, 0.0] 5. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0309 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: Create a New Body (NewBodyFeatureOperation) Upon completion, the first part should be a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a triangular base, with a width of 0.0309 meters and a height of 0.75 meters. The length, as specified in the final shape, is not relevant to this part, since the prism can stretch indefinitely along this axis without affecting its basic shape.</description>
